bitfield.description: Memory Barrier Chain Control Register implementation 0x0: Not present 0x1: Present
Transaction Attribute 1 Register implementation 0x0: Not present 0x1: Present
Transaction Attribute 0 Register implementation 0x0: Not present 0x1: Present
Auxillary Control Register implementation 0x0: Not present 0x1: Present
Data Bus Width 0x0: 8 bits 0x1: 16 bits 0x2: 32 bits 0x3: 64 bits 0x4: 128 bits All other values: Reserved
Address Bus Width 0x0: 8 bits 0x1: 16 bits 0x2: 24 bits 0x3: 32 bits 0x4: 36 bits 0x5: 40 bits 0x6: 64 bits 0x7: Reserved
Number of Watchpoints supported (0-15)
0x0: Trigger disabled. Trigger output (MA_WP_TRIGGER) will not fire 0x1: Trigger enabled. Trigger output (MA_WP_TRIGGER) will fire

register.description: Debug Watchpoint Addr0 Register (lower order bits 31:0). This register should be written only when WP_EN=0.

bitfield.description: The byte-addressable lower order AXI-4 physical watchpoint address to monitor

register.description: Debug Watchpoint Addr0 Register (higher order bits 39:32). This register should be written only when WP_EN=0.

bitfield.description: The byte-addressable higher order AXI-4 physical watchpoint address to monitor
Watchpoint trigger 0x0: Watchpoint not triggered 0x1: Watchpoint has triggered (Reset upon 0-&gt;1 transition of WP_EN)
Beat Select (This parameter decides upon for which beat of the burst the data byte lanes should be captured data)
Supervisor/User access 0x0: Reserved 0x1: User 0x2: Supervisor 0x3: No preference
Secure/Non-secure access 0x0: Reserved 0x1: Non-secure 0x2: Secure. Not supported on GP device 0x3: No preference
Watchpoint address mask (bits to ignore) 0x0: Ignore address bit 0 ..... 0x27: Ignore address bit 39 0x28 – 0x3F: Reserved
Watchpoint match criteria 0x0: Match if access within address range to include MIN and MAX 0x1: Match if access outside address range

Watchpoint Load/Store access 0x0: (Load) Load exclusive or swap 0x1: (Store) Store exclusive or swap (non-posted) 0x2: (Store) Store exclusive or swap (posted) 0x3: Any type of store 0x4, 0x5, 0x6: Reserved 0x7: No preference (valid only if CHAIN_WP_EN=0; otherwise, reserved) Note: In the case of CHAIN_WP_EN=1, both data and memory barrier watchpoints must have the same transaction type; that is, both must be read or both must be write
Watchpoint enable 0x0: Disable the watchpoint 0x1: Enable the watchpoint

register.description: Debug Watchpoint Auxilliary Control Register. This register should be written only when WP_EN=0.

bitfield.description: MA splitter target 0x0: Reserved 0x1: AXI2OCP bridge 0x2: EMIF 0x3: No preference

Initiator ID 0x0: CPU_0 0x1: CPU_1 0x2: CPU_2. Not supported on this device 0x3: CPU_3. Not supported on this device 0x4: Unknown source (ACP, FEQ, etc) 0x5: CMU. Not supported on this device 0x6: Reserved 0x7: No preference
Access type 0x0: Reserved 0x1: Instructions 0x2: Data/others 0x3: No preference

register.description: Debug Watchpoint Memory Barrier Control Register. This register should be written only when WP_EN=0.

bitfield.description: Memory barrier trigger 0x0: Memory Barrier Watchpoint not triggered 0x1: Memory Barrier Watchpoint has triggered (Reset upon 0-&gt;1 transition of MEM_BAR_WP_EN)

Type of memory barrier access 0x0: Reserved 0x1: Read 0x2: Write 0x3: Don't care (only if CHAIN_WP_EN=0; otherwise, reserved) Note: In the case of CHAIN_WP_EN=1, both memory barrier and data watchpoint must have the same transaction types; that is, both must be read or both must be write
Memory barrier type 0x0: Reserved 0x1: DSB 0x2: DMB 0x3: No preference
Memory barrier watchpoint enable 0x0: Disable the watchpoint 0x1: Enable the watchpoint

register.description: Debug Watchpoint Data/Memory Barrier Chain Control Register. This register should be written only when WP_EN=0.

bitfield.description: Chained watchpoints (memory barrier and data watchpoint) trigger 0x0: Chained Watchpoints not triggered 0x1: Chained Watchpoints have triggered (Reset upon 0-&gt;1 transition of CHAIN_WP_EN)
Chain type 0x0: Watchpoint match then memory barrier match 0x1: Memory barrier match then watchpoint match

Chained watchpoints (memory barrier and data watchpoint) enable 0x0: Disable the chained watchpoints 0x1: Enable the chained watchpoints Note: Both the memory barrier and data watchpoint should be enabled subsequent to this to avoid partial match/race conditions

register.description: Debug Watchpoint Addr0 Log Register (lower order bits 31:0). This register should be read only when TRIG=1 or WP_EN=0. This register is reset upon 0->1 transition of WP_EN.

bitfield.description: Watchpoint address lower order bits (bits 31:0) (The byte-addressable lower order AXI-4 physical watchpoint address bits which results in a match)

register.description: Debug Watchpoint Addr0 Log Register (higher order bits 39:32). This register should be read only when TRIG=1 or WP_EN=0. This register is reset upon 0->1 transition of WP_EN.

bitfield.description: Watchpoint address higher order bits (bits 39:32) (The byte-addressable higher order AXI-4 physical watchpoint address bits which results in a match)

register.description: Debug Watchpoint Data Log Register (bits 31:0). This register should be read only when TRIG=1 or WP_EN=0. This register is reset upon 0->1 transition of WP_EN.

bitfield.description: Data capture (bits 31:0) (32-bit data associated with the access which results in a watchpoint match)

register.description: Debug Watchpoint Data Log Register (bits 63:32). This register should be read only when TRIG=1 or WP_EN=0. This register is reset upon 0->1 transition of WP_EN.

bitfield.description: Data capture (bits 63:32) (32-bit data associated with the access which results in a watchpoint match)

register.description: Debug Watchpoint Data Log Register (bits 95:64). This register should be read only when TRIG=1 or WP_EN=0. This register is reset upon 0->1 transition of WP_EN.

bitfield.description: Data capture (bits 95:64) (32-bit data associated with the access which results in a watchpoint match)

register.description: Debug Watchpoint Data Log Register (bits 127:96). This register should be read only when TRIG=1 or WP_EN=0. This register is reset upon 0->1 transition of WP_EN.

bitfield.description: Data capture (bits 127:96) (32-bit data associated with the access which results in a watchpoint match)

register.description: Debug Watchpoint Transaction Attributes 0 Log Register. This register should be read only when TRIG=1 or WP_EN=0. This register is reset upon 0->1 transition of WP_EN.

bitfield.description: Response info 0x0: Reserved 0x1: Okay 0x2: Request failed 0x3: Request error

Initiator info 0x0: CPU_0 0x1: CPU_1 0x2: CPU_2. Not supported on this device 0x3: CPU_3. Not supported on this device 0x4: Unknown source (ACP, FEQ, etc) 0x5: CMU. Not supported on this device 0x6, 0x7: Reserved
Target info 0x0: AXI2OCP 0x1: EMIF All other values: Reserved

Transaction type (The type of transaction which results in a watchpoint match and is protocol independent. Not all protocols support all transaction types) 0x0: Reserved 0x1: Write posted 0x2: Read 0x3: Read exclusive 0x4: Read linked 0x5: Write non-posted 0x6: Write conditional 0x7: Broadcast
Burst length (The length of the burst which results in a watchpoint match) 0x1: Burst length = 1 (min value) 0x2: Burst length = 2 ..... 0x3F: Burst length = 63 (max value)
Burst type 0x0: Incrementing 0x1: Wrapping 0x3: Fixed (streaming) All other values: Reserved

register.description: Debug Watchpoint Transaction Attributes 1 Log Register. This register should be read only when TRIG=1 or WP_EN=0. This register is reset upon 0->1 transition of WP_EN.

bitfield.description: Data access/Instruction fetch 0x0: Other, data, PLE, eviction 0x1: Instruction
Supervisor/User access 0x0: User 0x1: Supervisor
Secure/Non-secure access 0x0: Non-secure 0x1: Secure. Not supported on GP device

register.description: Debug Watchpoint Data Transaction Attributes 0 Log Register. This register should be read only when TRIG=1 or WP_EN=0. This register is reset upon 0->1 transition of WP_EN.

bitfield.description: Byte enable (Byte enables for the 128-bit of data captured for the transaction match)
